## LookupByPath.findChildPath() method

> This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

Searches for the item associated with `childPath` , or the nearest ancestor of that path that has an associated item.

**Signature:**

```typescript
findChildPath(childPath: string): TItem | undefined;
```

## Parameters

| Parameter | Type   | Description |
| --------- | ------ | ----------- |
| childPath | string |             |

**Returns:**

TItem \| undefined

the found item, or `undefined` if no item was found

## Example

```ts
const tree = new LookupByPath([
  ['foo', 1],
  ['foo/bar', 2]
]);
tree.findChildPath('foo/baz'); // returns 1
tree.findChildPath('foo/bar/baz'); // returns 2
```
